Pro Log: AG2R bin brown bibs, Jumbo-Visma become Visma-Lease a Bike and Tobias Foss signs with Ineos Grenadiers

Welcome back to another edition of Pro Log. While the road racing may be calming down, cyclocross continues to heat up. Pim Ronhaar (Baloise Trek Lions) won the latest World Cup race in Dublin for the men.  

Results powered by FirstCycling.com

After a string of podiums this November, Lucinda Brand (Baloise Trek Lions) hit the top step in Dublin for her 50th elite victory in cyclocross, beating Alpecin-Deceuninck’s Ceylin del Carmen Alvarado – who had won her previous four races in Niel, Dendermonde, Hoogstraten and Troyes – by 38 seconds. Britain’s Zoe Bäckstedt (Canyon-SRAM) finished third. 

Team news continues to keep us ticking over until the new year. The latest developments include AG2R’s fashion crime, the new name for Jumbo-Visma, and where Tobias Foss is headed for the 2024 season.

AG2R-Citroën become Decathlon-AG2R La Mondiale – and ditch brown shorts! 

WELCOME ON BOARD !
À partir du 1er janvier 2024, @Decathlon devient co-partenaire de l'équipe cycliste @AG2RLAMONDIALE.

Nos coureurs de l’équipe DECATHLON AG2R LA MONDIALE pourront compter sur le savoir-faire de @van_rysel pour leur équipement en vélos, casques et lunettes. pic.twitter.com/cJ0PIOdQ5c

— DECATHLON AG2R LA MONDIALE TEAM (@AG2RCITROENTEAM) November 27, 2023

Goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, brown bibs. You were bigger than the whole sky. Taylor Swift lyrics aside, the brown bibs worn by iterations of AG2R-Citroën, now renamed Decathlon-AG2R La Mondiale, became an icon in the cycling world. Like Marmite, people either loved or hated them.  

I initially dipped a toe in the dislike side upon their inception. They’re brown, who wants to ride in those? Oh, how wrong I was. I quickly embraced the Rule-breaking colour, forming a parasocial relationship with a cut of fabric as many did over the years. 

With the arrival of new title sponsor Decathlon, however, the bib shorts are now black, with the jersey a combination of white and light blue for the WorldTour, development and U19 teams. Following the end of BMC’s three-year partnership with the squad, they will now ride with Decathlon’s Van Rysel bikes, helmets and glasses. 

Alongside the new kit and bike reveal, Decathlon-AG2R La Mondiale announced a plethora of signings, including sprinter Sam Bennett from Bora-Hansgrohe, Victor Lafay from Cofidis and Bruno Armirail from Groupama-FDJ. 

Taylor Swift was not available for comment.

Jumbo-Visma become Visma-Lease a Bike

From 2024, Jumbo-Visma will ride under the new name of Visma-Lease a Bike (officially, the new name is Team Visma | Lease a Bike, but there are only so many crimes against punctuation we’re prepared to endure). Lease a Bike – which is owned by the same conglomerate that owns the team’s bike sponsor Cervélo as well as a long list brands including Audi, Bentley, Bugatti, Cannondale, GT Bicycles, Lamborghini, Nimbl, Porsche, Santa Cruz, Schwinn, Seat, Škoda, Urban Arrow and Volkswagen – had sponsored the team under a smaller umbrella but stepped up to cover the loss of Jumbo.  

Jumbo-Visma have been the biggest topic of off-season conversations so far, including the failed merger with Soudal-QuickStep and the departure of Primož Roglič to Bora-Hansgrohe.  

‘Fanboy’ Tobias Foss to Ineos Grenadiers 

About 11 years ago the kid on the picture would always sneak in a garment from his favourite cycling team. Truly a dream come true to join this team. Very excited for the future! https://t.co/HwxNbjs7pr pic.twitter.com/KcSUKyVVcX

— Tobias Svendsen Foss (@Tobias_S_Foss) November 27, 2023

On the topic of departures from Jumbo-Visma, Tobias Foss will leave the team to join Ineos Grenadiers on a three-year contract. Foss, a former individual time-trial World Champion, is eyeing the 2024 Paris Olympics among other goals.   

Speaking about his new team, Foss said, ‘When I was 14 years old and started cycling, Edvald Boasson Hagen and Team Sky became my idols and my favourite team. After that, Chris [Froome], Bradley [Wiggins] and Geraint [Thomas] inspired me as I dreamt of the Tour de France. 

‘I still can’t believe that this is happening; it’s funny as I was the biggest fanboy ever of this team and now I am actually in the team!’
